Platform.Title: CSU TBVTRM Mycobacterium tuberculosis 4.2K DNA Microarray
Platform.Manufacturer: Colorado State University TB Vaccine Testing and Research Materials Contract

Sample.Title: M.tb at 0h, biological rep1

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: untreated (Control) samples were treated with the appropriate solvent vehicle.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: A portion of a recently frozen stock was inoculated into 5 ml of complete Middlebrook 7H9 broth (7H9) supplemented with 10% albumin dextrose catalase, v/v, and 0.05% Tween-80, v/v (Sigma, St. Louis, MO), and incubated at 37oC for 5 days. Then the culture was transferred into 50 ml of 7H9 media and incubated at 37oC with 50 rpm shaking until growth reached log phase.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated using the Trizol bead beater method, DNase treated, and purified (RNeasy; Qiagen) and its quantity assessed using a NanoDrop spectrophotometer.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: 10 µg of total RNA were primed with 2 µl of 100 µM T16N2 DNA primer at 70°C for 10 min, then reversed transcribed at 42°C for 1 h in the presence of 400 U SuperScript II RTase (Invitrogen), and 100 µM each dATP, dTTP, dGTP, with 25 µM dCTP, 25 µM Cy3-label

Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated using the Trizol bead beater method, DNase treated, and purified (RNeasy; Qiagen) and its quantity assessed using a NanoDrop spectrophotometer.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 10 µg of total RNA were primed with 2 µl of 100 µM T16N2 DNA primer at 70°C for 10 min, then reversed transcribed at 42°C for 1 h in the presence of 400 U SuperScript II RTase (Invitrogen), and 100 µM each dATP, dTTP, dGTP, with 25 µM dCTP, 25 µM Cy3-label

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The Tuberculosis Genome Oligo Set consisting of 70mer probes representing 4,269 Mtb (H37Rv and CDC1551) genes, plus 26 controls were obtained from “TB Vaccine Testing and Research Materials” Contract, Colorado State University. Experiments were performed according to standard Mycobacteria Research Laboratories (MRL) at Colorado State University protocols (http://www.cvmbs.colostate.edu/mip/tb/pdf/arrays.pdf).
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanned on an Agilent G2565AA scanner. Biological duplicate hybridizations were performed using PDS samples derived from THZ treated and vehicle treated control samples of M. tuberculosis. Spots with i) imperfect spot morphology; ii) a signal to noise ratio < 1.5 in more than 50% of instances; iii) saturated intensity for >65% of the pixels in at least one channel; and iv) co-efficient of variance >20% within the quadruplicates on one slide, were excluded from analysis.
Sample.Data-Processing: Data were analyzed using S+ scripts within Spotfire DecisionSite for Microarray Analysis (TIBCO-Spotfire Inc.) to determine statistically significant expression changes, adjusting for intensity bias using Locally Weighted Scatter-plot Smoothing (LOWESS) normalization (Mehra et al., 2009).

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: normalized Lowess log2 ratio (Cy5/Cy3) representing test/reference

Sample.Title: M.tb at 0h, biological rep2

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: untreated (Control) samples were treated with the appropriate solvent vehicle.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: A portion of a recently frozen stock was inoculated into 5 ml of complete Middlebrook 7H9 broth (7H9) supplemented with 10% albumin dextrose catalase, v/v, and 0.05% Tween-80, v/v (Sigma, St. Louis, MO), and incubated at 37oC for 5 days. Experiments were performed according to standard Mycobacteria Research Laboratories (MRL) at Colorado State University protocols (http://www.cvmbs.colostate.edu/mip/tb/pdf/arrays.pdf).

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: normalized Lowess log2 ratio (Cy5/Cy3) representing test/reference

Sample.Title: M.tb at 1h, 1X MIC, biological rep1

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis culture at 1h, treated with 1XMIC
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: THZ (Sigma) was added to the culture at a final concentration of 1XMIC and the culture was then incubated at 37oC
Channel.Growth-Protocol: A portion of a recently frozen stock was inoculated into 5 ml of complete Middlebrook 7H9 broth (7H9) supplemented with 10% albumin dextrose catalase, v/v, and 0.05% Tween-80, v/v (Sigma, St. Louis, MO), and incubated at 37oC for 5 days. Then the culture was transferred into 50 ml of 7H9 media and incubated at 37oC with 50 rpm shaking until growth reached log phase.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated using the Trizol bead beater method, DNase treated, and purified (RNeasy; Qiagen) and its quantity assessed using a NanoDrop spectrophotometer.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: 10 µg of total RNA were primed with 2 µl of 100 µM T16N2 DNA primer at 70°C for 10 min, then reversed transcribed at 42°C for 1 h in the presence of 400 U SuperScript II RTase (Invitrogen), and 100 µM each dATP, dTTP, dGTP, with 25 µM dCTP, 25 µM Cy3-label

Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated using the Trizol bead beater method, DNase treated, and purified (RNeasy; Qiagen) and its quantity assessed using a NanoDrop spectrophotometer.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 10 µg of total RNA were primed with 2 µl of 100 µM T16N2 DNA primer at 70°C for 10 min, then reversed transcribed at 42°C for 1 h in the presence of 400 U SuperScript II RTase (Invitrogen), and 100 µM each dATP, dTTP, dGTP, with 25 µM dCTP, 25 µM Cy3-label

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The Tuberculosis Genome Oligo Set consisting of 70mer probes representing 4,269 Mtb (H37Rv and CDC1551) genes, plus 26 controls were obtained from “TB Vaccine Testing and Research Materials” Contract, Colorado State University. Experiments were performed according to standard Mycobacteria Research Laboratories (MRL) at Colorado State University protocols (http://www.cvmbs.colostate.edu/mip/tb/pdf/arrays.pdf).
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanned on an Agilent G2565AA scanner. Biological duplicate hybridizations were performed using PDS samples derived from THZ treated and vehicle treated control samples of M. tuberculosis. Spots with i) imperfect spot morphology; ii) a signal to noise ratio < 1.5 in more than 50% of instances; iii) saturated intensity for >65% of the pixels in at least one channel; and iv) co-efficient of variance >20% within the quadruplicates on one slide, were excluded from analysis.
Sample.Description: Comparisons of THZ treated(1X MIC) (ch1) vs non-treated cultures at 1h (ch2)
Sample.Data-Processing: Data were analyzed using S+ scripts within Spotfire DecisionSite for Microarray Analysis (TIBCO-Spotfire Inc.) to determine statistically significant expression changes, adjusting for intensity bias using Locally Weighted Scatter-plot Smoothing (LOWESS) normalization (Mehra et al., 2009).

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: normalized Lowess log2 ratio (Cy5/Cy3) representing test/reference

Spots with i) imperfect spot morphology; ii) a signal to noise ratio < 1.5 in more than 50% of instances; iii) saturated intensity for >65% of the pixels in at least one channel; and iv) co-efficient of variance >20% within the quadruplicates on one slide, were excluded from analysis.
Sample.Description: Comparisons of THZ treated (4X MIC) (ch1) vs non-treated cultures at 2h (ch2)
Sample.Data-Processing: Data were analyzed using S+ scripts within Spotfire DecisionSite for Microarray Analysis (TIBCO-Spotfire Inc.) to determine statistically significant expression changes, adjusting for intensity bias using Locally Weighted Scatter-plot Smoothing (LOWESS) normalization (Mehra et al., 2009).

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: normalized Lowess log2 ratio (Cy5/Cy3) representing test/reference

Sample.Title: M.tb at 4h, 1X MIC, biological rep1

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis culture at 4h, treated with 1XMIC
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: THZ (Sigma) was added to the culture at a final concentration of 1XMIC and the culture was then incubated at 37oC
Channel.Growth-Protocol: A portion of a recently frozen stock was inoculated into 5 ml of complete Middlebrook 7H9 broth (7H9) supplemented with 10% albumin dextrose catalase, v/v, and 0.05% Tween-80, v/v (Sigma, St. Louis, MO), and incubated at 37oC for 5 days. Then the culture was transferred into 50 ml of 7H9 media and incubated at 37oC with 50 rpm shaking until growth reached log phase.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated using the Trizol bead beater method, DNase treated, and purified (RNeasy; Qiagen) and its quantity assessed using a NanoDrop spectrophotometer.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: 10 µg of total RNA were primed with 2 µl of 100 µM T16N2 DNA primer at 70°C for 10 min, then reversed transcribed at 42°C for 1 h in the presence of 400 U SuperScript II RTase (Invitrogen), and 100 µM each dATP, dTTP, dGTP, with 25 µM dCTP, 25 µM Cy3-label

Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated using the Trizol bead beater method, DNase treated, and purified (RNeasy; Qiagen) and its quantity assessed using a NanoDrop spectrophotometer.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 10 µg of total RNA were primed with 2 µl of 100 µM T16N2 DNA primer at 70°C for 10 min, then reversed transcribed at 42°C for 1 h in the presence of 400 U SuperScript II RTase (Invitrogen), and 100 µM each dATP, dTTP, dGTP, with 25 µM dCTP, 25 µM Cy3-label

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The Tuberculosis Genome Oligo Set consisting of 70mer probes representing 4,269 Mtb (H37Rv and CDC1551) genes, plus 26 controls were obtained from “TB Vaccine Testing and Research Materials” Contract, Colorado State University. Experiments were performed according to standard Mycobacteria Research Laboratories (MRL) at Colorado State University protocols (http://www.cvmbs.colostate.edu/mip/tb/pdf/arrays.pdf).
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanned on an Agilent G2565AA scanner. Biological duplicate hybridizations were performed using PDS samples derived from THZ treated and vehicle treated control samples of M. tuberculosis. Spots with i) imperfect spot morphology; ii) a signal to noise ratio < 1.5 in more than 50% of instances; iii) saturated intensity for >65% of the pixels in at least one channel; and iv) co-efficient of variance >20% within the quadruplicates on one slide, were excluded from analysis.
Sample.Description: Comparisons of THZ treated (1X MIC) (ch1) vs non-treated cultures at 4h (ch2)
Sample.Data-Processing: Data were analyzed using S+ scripts within Spotfire DecisionSite for Microarray Analysis (TIBCO-Spotfire Inc.) to determine statistically significant expression changes, adjusting for intensity bias using Locally Weighted Scatter-plot Smoothing (LOWESS) normalization (Mehra et al., 2009).

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: normalized Lowess log2 ratio (Cy5/Cy3) representing test/reference

Series.Title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis gene expression in response to thioridazine (THZ)
Series.Summary: The gene expression profiles of Mtb after treatment at the minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) or 4 X MIC at an early stage (up to 6 hours) was compared to untreated Mtb.
Series.Overall-Design: Our experiment is designed to in order to ensure that the primary effects (0-6h) of the drugs and any dose (1X MIC and 4X MIC) responses would be captured.
